title: Nothing Can Separate Us From the Love of God
quoted_scripture: This is love: it is not that we loved God but that he loved us and sent his Son as the sacrifice that deals with our sins.
body_text:
I am a pastor. In my sixth year of my ministry I went through a divorce. The divorce was complex due to the suffering, shame and despair I lived through for several years.  During this painful experience I came to know God's miraculous grace first hand.  God's unconditional love was evident in the support of my family, friends and the church I served. Thanks to this unconditional love, I was able to continue with my pastoral  responsibilities throughout the divorce process.

I found healing from that experience and continue to serve as pastor. God restored me and gave me a new perspective to serve as an instrument of his grace to others.  God used this experience to help me be slow to judge and quicker to show love.  I learned that God expects us to love others as God loves us: unconditionally.
Nothing can separate us from the love of God, not our failures or our flaws.

I am living proof of the healing God can bring through grace. I have a loving wife with whom I have established a wholesome marriage.  In my heart I have only gratitude because this has been a gift from God.  God's unconditional love heals, restores and makes all things new.
prayer: Thank you, God, for your unconditional love.  Help us to love others the same way you love us: unconditionally.  Amen.
